title: Scientists Employ Robot Bunnies To Combat Invasive Florida Pythons
description: Florida is luring invasive Burmese pythons into traps by deploying robotic bunnies to mimic the warmth and movement of real marsh rabbits, with traditional methods having been no use in controlling the growing snake population. What do you think? The post Scientists Employ Robot Bunnies To Combat Invasive Florida Pythons appeared first on The Onion.
author: The Onion Staff
excerpt: Florida is luring invasive Burmese pythons into traps by deploying robotic bunnies to mimic the warmth and movement of real marsh rabbits, with traditional methods having been no use in controlling the growing snake population. What do you think?
text: Florida is luring invasive Burmese pythons into traps by deploying robotic bunnies to mimic the warmth and movement of real marsh rabbits, with traditional methods having been no use in controlling the growing snake population. What do you think? “More jobs lost to automation.” Peggy Costa, Gymnast’s Apprentice “It must suck to be a real bunny stuck in a cubicle someplace remotely piloting one of these.” Brett Sudol, Cactus Supplier “Aw, but that takes all the gore out of it!” Edmund Eckstein, Unemployed Like A Vitamin You Ingest With Your Eyes. html:
Florida is luring invasive Burmese pythons into traps by deploying robotic bunnies to mimic the warmth and movement of real marsh rabbits, with traditional methods having been no use in controlling the growing snake population. What do you think?

“More jobs lost to automation.”

Peggy Costa, Gymnast’s Apprentice

“It must suck to be a real bunny stuck in a cubicle someplace remotely piloting one of these.”

Brett Sudol, Cactus Supplier

“Aw, but that takes all the gore out of it!”

Edmund Eckstein, Unemployed

Like A Vitamin You Ingest With Your Eyes. Get The Onion Newsletter.
